Reviews.Content: Perfect Honeymoon Destination       Our Guestroom
Reviews.Author: LadybugNYC

Reviews.Content: Tugu is Very Special I stayed at the Tugu with my 23 y.o. daughter and we both loved the Tugu for many of the same, but also different reasons.We loved walking around the hotel and discovering beautiful antiques and special rooms around each corner. We loved picking where we were going to eat dinner in one of their incredible rooms surrounded by antique pieces of Bali's history. We loved the spa and especially the outdoor spa and the wonderful therapist they have there. We loved our room that felt like a lovely suite in a friends house, so unique and special. And we loved every minute we got to stay and enjoy the wonderful staff of the Tugu.My daughter is a surfer and I think Canngu was her favorite place to surf and it is right in front of the hotel. There were a few other surfers from around the world staying there and they all had a good time together. I would have coffee brought out to the lounges on the beach and have never enjoyed my morning coffee more! I walked the beach and it is peaceful, safe and interesting. There are a few restaurants north of the hotel but we ate all our meals at the hotel and I am not sorry...the meals were fabulous. This is an amazing, special place that if you have the chance to stay there, you should. I cannot wait to go to their new hotel on Lombok.
Reviews.Author: kklynn

Reviews.Content: This is a museum We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon and I was a little dissapointed.. the hotel is fenced off for security and is set back from the beach. The ocean here has loads of rocks, and is more ideal for experienced surfers that sunbathing. the beach had about 6 deck chairs for the hotel guests, but that too was set back and a little ramshackled looking, so we spent lots of time at the pool. We only discovered then that the hotel also labels itself as a museum hotel, so is filled with antiques and the same dark musty vibe that accompanies museums. That said: the service was exceptional (one can eat anywhere and anytime - they will set up a table anywhere on their premises) and our room was nice, but i found it all too rustic for the price we were paying. Our highlight was discovering the Italian owned Sticky Fingers on Echo Beach close by, where we spent ages on their roof terrace, sipping marvellously massive cocktails (at half the price of the hotel's and twice the size), overlooking the ocean and surfers. Seminyak's shopping and restaurants is about a 20 min taxi ride from Canggu..
Reviews.Author: TheBiffs

Reviews.Content: TUGU WAS AMAZING! After extensive research utilizing this website (as well as others) we decided on Tugu Bali for our 4 night stay in Bali. We were originally planning on staying in Ubud, but were unable to secure reservations on short notice. We must say that the experience at Tugu Bali left absolutely nothing to be desired. From the driver who picked us up at the airport, to the receptionist who checked us in, to the chefs, to the wait staff....we cannot rave enough about this place! As an aside, we STRONGLY suggest that anyone flying into Bali secure a hotel which features VIP pickup service at the airport. The driver will somehow manage to secure the visa for you and whisk you through customs in less than 10 minutes. Had we not had this service provided to us by the Tugu, we would have had to wait in a 1.5 hour line in a terminal with weak A/C!! Getting back to the hotel. The unique part of the Tugu is that, unlike the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton, the fact that the hotel only has 21 villas allows the staff to provide a truly personalized and genuinely accomodating experience for you. For example, there is no set restaurant. There is one extensive menu which features exceptional Balinese, Javanese and Western dishes. You can elect to take your meals ANYWHERE on the hotel grounds: by the pool, on the sand by the beach, in a classic 17th century Chinese pavilion, or in about 10 other areas. Chances are good that you will be the only ones dining in your chosen spot. Very romantic. You can even opt for a classic Balinese dinner during which you will (literally) be treated like royalty and have the staff perform traditional Balinese dances in native dress while you gorge on the seven-course meal. Wow!We encountered no problems whatsoever during our stay and staff was 110% accomodating in our every request. They do not know how to say no! They arranged excursions for us, took care of arranging for a very knowledgeable driver who basically was at our disposal for 9 hours and the total charge was only $65.00 USD!Now don't get me wrong, we did visit the Four Seasons Jimbaran for (very over-priced for Bali) cocktails and it was pretty enough with hundreds of candles on the beach and a live band performing on the sand. However, the atmosphere seemed a bit contrived and we were surrounded by dozens of other couples. The beach at Jimbaran is also quite crowded. This is fine if that is what you are looking for. However, for about a quarter of the price of any of these large luxury chains, you can have a beach populated only by a few surfers, truly personal and attentive service from a staff who treats you like family from the get-go and is truly among the best that we have encountered in out extensive travels throughout Asia (or the world, for that matter), and food that is out-of-this world! Book at Tugu Bali....you won't regret it. We cannot wait to return!
Reviews.Author: cgutierr99

Reviews.Content: A little Jewel in Bali A jewel of Bali.Traditional Baslinese villas with the best friendliest staff on the islandNot a resort and well away from the mad crowds. Romantic, secluded, caring and a lovely place to stay.
Reviews.Author: vacationerfmsing

Reviews.Content: Marvellous small hotel We stayed in the Hotel Tugu Bali for 4 nights in September 2008. We hadn't planned it this way but we ended up spending the entire time in the hotel. The service is near-flawless, the gardens and communal areas are of exceptional interest and the food is excellent. Drinks and snacks are never more than a few minutes away and every staff member was as welcoming and warm as I've ever seen at a hotel. It's pretty pricey all round but that doesn't seem so bad given the standards of the place. It's truly endearing to see the hotel staff sitting out under a canopy making flower garlands and decorations for the rooms or a Balinese dance class for local girls taking place in the gardens. It gives a sense of staying in an implausibly lovely local house.The only negatives I can think of are: the pool although very pleasant needs to be retiled and features a strange, sudden ledge; the beach is not really for swimming as the waves can be formidable; and the turn-down service arrived at inconvenient moments. All small minuses on what was a thoroughly relaxing stay.
Reviews.Author: JLorca

Reviews.Content: Special place with a real Indonesian spirit My husband  I stayed here for 3 nights in July, in an Ocean View Rejang Suite. We found the hotel to be a very special place which strives to present a real Indonesian experience. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an alternative to the standard hip hotels.The hotel is beautifully decorated with Indonesian antiques which the owner has collected  built in a dark indonesian wood; it feels old-fashioned, in a nice way. The main hall is an incredible example of Balinese architecture, with a soaring ceiling and gorgeous polished wood beams, stage  floors. The dining rooms  grounds are chock full of interesting items  spaces to examine (e.g., an old apothecary, antique beauty parlor, etc)  landscaped with ponds  many flowering plants.The rooms are organized in Indonesian style 2-storey buildings. Our room was on the top floor overlooking the beach  was decorated in a colonial style, with dark wood, paned fully-opening windows, a separate small lounge with large soaking tub, 4-poster bed  antique style fixtures. It was simple, comfortable  traditional, which we liked; but do not expect a flat panel TV or noiseless a/c.We found the service to be warm, friendly  competent, with all of the staff speaking excellent english (a rarity even in well-touristed Bali). The Indonesian food is among the best  most authentic I have ever had in Bali (in my 13 trips staying at top hotels  private villas); it is overseen by a genteel matron from Java who also teaches the cooking school (a terrific experience involving traditional cooking techniques taught in the hotel's outdoor warung kitchen, which I definitely recommend). It is clear that the owners  staff strive to present the cultures  traditions of Indonesia to the guests in their choices of activities  food. The dinner experience is truly special, with guests being able to choose to dine in one of the beautifully decorated private pavilions with a choice of several traditional menus (make sure to book this in advance!). We booked a dinner for 8 in the Bale Puputan, which was magical.The only negatives I would mention are the spa services - the treatment menu is ambitious but the execution was a bit disappointing -  the pool, which is small  not particularly conducive to lounging.
Reviews.Author: IPGHK

Reviews.Content: Peace and Beauty We started our 2-week Bali vacation with 4 nights at the Tugu. After 48 hours of traveling, it was perfect. Our room was a second floor Rejang suite with an enclosed porch, huge sunken round bathtub, and a row of windows overlooking the ocean. The hotel property is so quiet and lovely, it was almost mystical (especially the open air lobby with 20 foot silk streamers). We found we were whispering all the time. We booked one dinner in the Black Chamber -- I don't want to ruin it for others, but suffice it to say that we were gobsmacked (in a very good way). The staff were friendly and helpful and the spa services were special. Tugu Bali is far from a party place and there's not much to do in the area. So, if you're not looking for peace and beauty, this is not the hotel for you.
Reviews.Author: pete4215

Reviews.Content: Such a Unique Experience My husband and I just stayed at the Tugu for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary. It was easily one of the loveliest places we stayed in Bali (the other favorite was the Komeneka in Ubud). We stayed in a Rejang Suite, and the room was beautifully decorated with exquisite attention to detail. There was an enclosed porch area where we could have our meals while watching the sunset, complete with a bathtub and private massage bed. Every day, the staff would have fresh flower and coconut palm arrangements waiting for us in our room, along with fresh fruit. The menu of activities and meal options were incredible - truly a case study in stellar marketing. My husband and I were so excited to explore all of the various amenities of the hotel.The meals themselves were also quite memorable. We had breakfast on the beach one morning (the Tugu has a small relatively private and secluded beach across a small driveway from the hotel) and another under the stars in a secluded part of the lush property. Our best meal was at Waroeng Tugu - a restaurant on the property styled after a traditional Javanese/Balinese eating hut. It was certainly the most gourmet and luxurious hut that we had ever eaten in, and a very apecial balinese experience. Those seeking an even more special experience can book a prix-fixe private meal in one of the three gorgeous pavilions on the property all decorated like miniature art galleries - the meals are pricey but likely perfect for that special occasion.The staff was excellent as well. Our room was made up practically every time we stepped out of our room, and the wait staff at the restaurant was amazing. The front desk staff was also very kind and friendly.Our stay at Canggu was wonderful - and for those considering whether to stay farther south in the more well-known tourist destinations such as Kuta or Seminyak - Canggu offers more romance and seclusion, more private beaches, and the Tugu.
Reviews.Author: ssjj2007

Reviews.Content: Relaxing retreat, highly recommended We spent the first 4 days of our honeymoon at Tugu. This gorgeous, unique, art-filled hotel is perfect if you want to treat yourself to a few days of indulgent rest and relaxation. Our room was luxurious, with an open-air bathroom and a private secluded outdoor area with a pool and access down to the beach. The hotel grounds and buildings are immaculate. But the best feature of this hotel has to be the quality of service provided by its staff, who were faultlessly cordial and attentive throughout our stay and make Tugu the real delight it is.
Reviews.Author: TheWardsLondon

Reviews.Content: Excellent We stayed here for 5 nights in May and had a great experience. The room was very comfortable and well decorated. The property itself is really neat -- all the different pieces of art, carvings, etc were really interesting to look at. The service at the hotel was excellent. Everyone was completely attentive and really seemed focused on making sure we enjoyed our stay. The staff really thought through details - for example, when we had dinner next to the pool, a table with candles, flowers and offerings was set up. Canggu is a wonderful area of Bali and the beach is pleasant, especially at low tide.Overall, we loved staying at the Tugu and would definitely go back. For us, it was the type of hotel that we actually wanted to spend time at and enjoy.
Reviews.Author: Plantriptoday

Reviews.Content: Disappointing and commercial We don't recommend this hotel and will never go back. Tugu Bali was our last stop in Bali, having been there for an amazing two weeks. It was also the most disappointing. The design is pretty, with some lovely antiques, though far from the spectacular environment of other hotels. Tugu Bali lacked the soul of other places in Bali and felt far more commercial. (A native guide said it didn't represent the true Bali. Based on our experience, he's right.) And if you have a medical emergency, as one of us did, forget it. The desk staff refused even to look up a doctor's number on the Internet for us so we could call. That was really shocking.There are so many other hotels with more beauty and more heart. Pita Maha, with its spectacular views in Ubud, magnificent villas at very reasonable prices, and its caring attitude was our favorite. With so many other fine choices in the south of Bali, we don't recommend Tugu Bali.
Reviews.Author: JuliaNYC

Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back My husband and I had two beautiful nights at the Tugu in Dec 2007. Our visit was at the end of our three month honeymoon and the Tugu was easily one of the most special places we stayed at.We had a gorgeous room with it's own swimming pool and partial outside bathroom. If, like me, you love all the little details then the notes you receive every night will melt your heart.We both enjoyed every meal we had at the Tugu. If you get the chance have a meal at the Lily Pond - it was so special. The staff are wonderful and look after your every need. Our friends stay in Canguu and we invited them for lunch. The staff found a lovely spot for us, set it up beautifully, provided a high chair for my friends baby and called our room to let us know our friends had arrived.The Tugu is like a home from home and all the little touches really made it so special. Since we have been home I emailed the Tugu to thank them for the lovely stay and the sent back a lovely email. That sums your Tugu experience up - they always have time to make you feel special. This hotel is like a little piece of paradise after the mayhem of Kuta. It is a relatively small hotel so the staff know who you are and we weren't asked once for our room number. If you visit Bali and are in need of a little haven the Tugu is definately for you.
Reviews.Author: pinkie25

Reviews.Content: Tranquility Abounds You cannot fault this place on style, elegance, friendliness and super-soothing ambience. It'll be too quiet for those that love to party, but if you want to curl up with a book to the sound of crashing waves after a perfect coconut fish meal wrapped in a banana leaf - this is the place for you. I just adored the exquisite, faultless service and calm tanquility of The Tugu - for RR with the girls, a romantic break or some quiet time it's a true sanctuary. Make time for a gorgeous spa treatment (or two) and a meditation therapy if you're a mega-stressed urbanite like me...
Reviews.Author: IntrepidWoods

Reviews.Content: Distinctively Different Hotel (in a good way!) We agree with all other reviews posted, this place is quite special and very unique. It is a far from a cookie-cutter hotel as you can get. It is definitely a slice of Balinese live and culture with beautiful grounds, quiet location and attentive service. If you are looking for a special place that gives you the feel of Bali, this is it!
Reviews.Author: LisaBAtlanta_GA

Reviews.Content: A wonderworld paradise       the beach
Reviews.Author: t16tomcat1

Reviews.Content: Great for honeymoons! Great hotel! We were there for the last three days of our honeymoon. We came from the Amandari and Amankila. What I loved about Tugu was the museum-quality atmosphere. We enjoyed exploring as you find interesting things around every corner. We also loved just sitting in the restaurant and listening to the Indian Ocean and feeling the soft breeze. The staff was very friendly and service-oriented. There were a few things that were not quite to my liking, however. The beds, although beautiful and part of the visual charm, were uncomfortable. I agree with the last review in that not everything needs to be antique. In addition, the Indian ocean there is not really swim-able if you're not a strong swimmer. The waves are huge and powerful......though great for surfing as there were many folks doing that in the mornings. One other thing was that, although also visually charming, the lily-pad ponds create the biggest problem associated with standing water.......mosquitoes. However, we still opened the windows of our suite to enjoy the breeze, coming back in with only a few bites.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys an experience unlike large chain resorts. This place is truly unique and I would come back in a heartbeat.
Reviews.Author: FidgetMD

Reviews.Content: A quaint little hotel..........perhaps overdone? I am now writing this review while sitting at the pool area, staying here for a total of 4 nights.In a nutshell, this hotel is outstanding in all aspects, friendliness and services of the staffs is impecabble, although I wouldn't say it is an exemplary one.The hotel itself is build on ponds, and the labyrinthine walkways linking each villa are both romantic and confusing. The owner himself is a fanatic art and antique collector, and you can surely tell by all his personal collections displayed in every corner of the hotel. Although it might not be in a bad way, but I feel that it is being overdone in few aspects. For example it certainly does not feel posh to have a sumptuous dinner eating from an obscure chipped wooden bowl. Another thing is I am very particular with regards to cleaniness, and it certainly does not feel good to arrive in a tastefully decorated room with spider webs in the bathroom corner and a yellow toe nail at the bedside. GOD knows if these were artfully left behind on purpose. Nevertheless I would highly recommend this hotel to newly web couples who seek tranquility in a remote part of bali, and be lost in this heavenly place one earth.
Reviews.Author: shaunsia

Reviews.Content: A lovely and unique experience This is definitely a great hotel to be in if you want to experience history, culture, hospitality, good food and personalized service. We loved the hotel setting with antiques everywhere and the romantic dinner by the beach to watch the sunset is definitely not to be missed. The hotel is owned and operated by the Anhar family. There is an interesting story about why the owner started the hotel. Read the book Gathering Places by Barbara Walker. The book can be found on the coffee table in the lobby. We stayed at a Rejang Suite wit a view of the Indian Ocean that had a great sunk in tub. An offering made of palm leaves woven in unique design and decorated with fresh flowers along with a plate full of fresh fruits are provided to us everyday. In the evening, a different but smaller palm leaves offering with a poem printed on raw paper were placed on wooden plate on our bed wishing us sweet dreams. We had massages in the Spa as well as the bale (hut) in the garden by the beach. Listening to the waves, feeling the sea breezes and hearing children's laughters in a distance, the massage offered a very unique experience. We tried all the different style of breakfast, Javanese, Balinese, Chinese and Western. We think the local favors far exceed the Western ones. The Chinese is not true Chinese. It was a new creation since the Chinese integrated with the Balinese for centuries. The only thing we were disappointed was the limited English skills of the staff. We also suggest not to book any tour from the hotel because their staff couldn't speak English well so he only acted as a driver. There was no local tour information offered and we had to ask the reception for a tour guide. We suggest to go into town to Kuta and negotiate with a tour/activities vendor. They are all over Kuta. They offer sharing tours or private tours. Private tour usually include driver, guide, entry fees and meals. We discovered that joining a tour with a credited tour guide is definitely the way to go. It was cheaper and you learn more. We had a great tour guide who had great knowledge of the culture and could speak English very well. His name is I Ketut Astadi. He works with his team mate driver Madam Rose. They both were a great team. His mobil phone is 08123615377. We learned a lot about the Balinese culture from him. If you can time it, try finding out when the next burial ceremony is and schedule yourself to be there. We missed it but we were told it would be quite an experience. We loved Bali and what it represents. We loved the people, the culture, the hospitality. We know we will be back there. Next time, I may want to start staying at Kuta to do all the shopping for two days, then, go to Ubud and stay there for a few days, and then end it with Hotel Tugu Bali where we can just relax and not go anywhere.
Reviews.Author: alang-alang

Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel We have just had a wonderful five days at the Hotel Tugu. The grounds and rooms are magnificent. Ths staff treat you like royalty. We had a great time trying items from their extensive menu and each night ate in a different beautiful temple room that are part of the hotel. There is lots to do in the area and the hotel drivers were good guides.For a really special experience, with all the flavor and beauty of old world Bali, this is the hotel to stay at.
Reviews.Author: ymc4

Reviews.Content: A Wonderful Refuge We are a little late in posting this review. This is one of our favorite places to stay on Bali. It is a little out of the way -- say 15 mintes to Legian but they provide free and timely transportation. The rooms are spacious, clean and so quiet. We found thhe food quite good and had intended to eat downtown but after a day touring we typically just chilled out and had dinner delivered to our pool room. What a serene experience. If you are more adventurous it's only 15 minutes to excellent restaurants downtown. The beach is across a small road and, like many Bali beches, is on black sand and iit does tend to stain the feet. But it is nice too walk on and the sunsets are glorious. We found the service very attentive --- all requests were speedily addressed. We will return.
Reviews.Author: Mountainmann

Reviews.Content: Tugu Is A Great Hotel for Couples Hotel Tugu is a wonderful boutique hotel, especially for couples looking to have a special holiday. We spent three nights in the Puri Le Mayeur suite which was a wonderful melange of lovely antiques and a beautiful natural setting.The hotel itself is full of interesting arrangements of antiques and interesting pavilions, set amidst a lovely natural setting.The special dinners we had arranged in various settings around the property were beautifully prepared and presented. The service was first rate, and the staff genuinely friendly and interested in looking after our needs.If you are looking for a relaxed environment in which to forget about touring for a while and just enjoy the slow natural pace of the island, this is the place.
Reviews.Author: BradleyG

Reviews.Content: you'll love this place The hotel is very unique. The public areas make you feel as though you are part of a museum... wonderful! The rooms are large and well furnished and the private plunge pool adds a great touch. we really enjoyed walking the grounds. overall the hotel is definitely worth the stay but that's not the best part. the service from the staff was absolutely one of the most memorable my wife and i have ever experienced. this includes the general manager and the staff. just amazing. the general manager took us into town one night for dinner because the taxi was late. the spa treatments were incredible. we had a combo of inside and by the ocean. you really will enjoy and we highly recommend. only thing that you should be aware of it is somewhat remote.
Reviews.Author: n2r49rs

Reviews.Content: Uniquely Balinese  We stayed at the Tugu for the beginning of our honeymoon in Bali. I can start by saying we loved this place much better than the FS Sayan. Tugu's service was phenomenal from the start....we were picked up at the airport and given refreshments for the ride. Once we arrived at the beautiful open air reception area, we again were offered a drink while they made the finishing touches on our room. We stayed in one of the suites with the private plunge pool- our room was great! I loved the gardens in our courtyard, but it was the huge outdoor bathtub that really did it for me...I think I was in there relaxing daily! The beach was small but lovely with not a lot of foot traffic. Our first meal was not excellent, but every meal we ate thereafter was wonderful. Breakfast and the toraja coffee was outstanding. We also had a spa credit with our package, which I would highly recommend. We had the Mandi Lular couples massage in the outside spa area, and it was delightful. We also took the cooking class which was also fun, although a little pricey. We made a few trips into town, but overall relaxed at the Tugu. Overall, this hotel was outstanding for its personal attention (most of the staff knew our names and we were only there for 5 days) and the decor. The decor is what sets it apart and made me say we liked it better than the FS. The FS just seemed very American/ western to us, and we really enjoyed all of the Balinese and Javanese antiques at Tugu, as well as the gardens and altars. It felt more like you were staying in the home of a very wealthy, welcoming Balinese than a chain hotel. The FS view is amazing and worth a visit, but we got more of the balinese experience that we were looking for from the Tugu. We hope to visit again!
Reviews.Author: tpnyc

Reviews.Content: tranquility meets class       market visit
Reviews.Author: azor.k

Reviews.Content: An Oasis of Tranquility and Historical Charm Well, I have been on a world trip for over 7 months now and one of the true standout hotels in our trip so far was the Hotel Tugu Bali in Seminyak, Bali. This 5 star hotel is a great balance to the Sayan -Four Seasons Hotel where we also stayed for a few days. If you are in Bali for over a week and want to save a little money and have a 5 Star experience, I would suggest 4 nights at the Hotel Tugu Bali and 3 nights at the Sayan. On a budget, but want 5 Star, the Sayan is out of the question and Tugu Bali is your best bet...and here's why:Arrived at the hotel and walked down to their intimate reception, was treated to juice and cold towels, then escorted through antique-lined rooms to cobblestone paths and subsiquently to a luxurious and spacious hotel room overlooking the ocean - on of only 22 rooms. Service was impeccable and the food was always traditional Balinese cuisiine served with a flare. Had a one-on-one Balinese cooking class with their chef while my partner enjoyed a sumptuous and truely relaxing Balinese massage. The look on his face was priceless when here returned from the massage and raved while we ate the meal that I had prepared with the chef.Right on the beach, one night, we watched the sun sink into the sea and ate a grilled seafood dinner prepared by the hotel right by our table. When I say that this is a gem of a hotel and an oasis of tranquility and historical Balinese charm, trust me, you will find it that way too...PS. We bought antiques while there and they arranged the transfer of all of my purchases the the shipping company after I left. Absolutely worth every penny at this place...Gold stars all around.
Reviews.Author: jteel11

Reviews.Content: You must stay here. I cannot describe how wonderful this Hotel is. From the moment you enter the walled grounds you really are in a different world. We were on honeymoon and I am so glad we avoided the bigger resort hotels like The Oberoi e.t.c. Hotel Tugu is very charming and unique. The staff are amazing - you don't need to sign for anything - they know who you are. The rooms are beautiful and our plunge pool and semi outdoor bathroom were fabulous. You can eat wherever you like, including the beautiful 18th Century Temple and all the food was very good. The Hotel is surrounded by antiques and history. It's hard to describe in words - go and visit!
Reviews.Author: Murph069

Reviews.Content: Love it so much have stayed 4 times We have lived in Asia for 16 years including 5 years in Indonesia, so we would consider ourselves quite expert on hidden tropical hotels.The Hotel Tugu is one of our all time favorites.NOT in the Bali tourist areas at all BUT only a 20 minute drive from Seminyak with all it's shops and restaurants.Unique, BIG rooms and the suites are to die for with original art high quality art etc..If you are an architectural buff (I am an architect) the Tugu has the most authentic and interesting collection of buidlings in Bali.Many were collected and moved to the hotel. We loved having a banquet in the Authentic Chinese temple and another time having a big family dinner in the old family hall. The hotel was written up in Architectural Digest a few years ago.The Tugu is located right on the beach at Canggu, which is considered the number 2 or 3 surfing beach in Bali. So it is a GREAT beach if you like to surf or just ride the waves. We have teenagers so they MUCH prefer to stay here than Sanur or Nusa Dua with no waves. It is also a much better beach thatn then north east coast near Candi Dasa. BUT it is a beach for stronger swimmers and surfers. It is NOT a beach for young children.The area near the hotel is very quiet with lots of rice paddies and we have enjoyed all day bike rides in the area heading west.It is a small hotel with actual authentic Balinese cuisine and not a wide range of other options. So we mix up our meals by going out to dinner and doing a bit of shopping beforehand in Seminyak.We love it so much that we have stayed four times and it is also a favorite of several other long term Asian Expats.It can be tricky these days to be a tourist in Bali. It has gotten very developed over the past 15 years. You have to be careful in finding the hidden, spiritual, idyllic Bali of your dreams. Stay away from Nusa Dua, Seminyak, Sanur etc... Instead try The Tugu in Canggu and mix it up with a few nights in the Ubud area for a completely different side of Bali. And by the way, the beaches of your dreams are not to be found anywhere in Bali, instead in Indonesia head to the eastern Islands of Komodo etc....
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: this is the ultimate getaway Just got back from a two weeks stay at Hotel Tugu Bali with my boyfriend. I read the reviews and checked their web page before but this place just totally exceeded our imagination. This place is such a unique romantic hideaway where you feel at home at the same time. The staff is sooo welcoming, charming and caring, that we all had tears in the eyes when we left. We ve been travelling quite a bit in South East Asia but this little secret place just tops everything in terms of luxury, service, food and uniqueness. I had to write this review, even though I like the Tugu Bali to the be the most well kept secret around
Reviews.Author: stevencole77

Reviews.Content: Authentic..But out of the way       View from Puri Le Mayeur Villa Deck

Reviews.Content: Trip to Bali - Hotel Tugu - July 2005       Hotel Tugu - Bali - Cooking Class

Reviews.Content: A secret hideaway in Bali! Extraordinary hotel!       Pool at night
Reviews.Author: Globbie

Reviews.Content: Simply the Best Bali Experience       entrance to our suite
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Worth the Trip My husband and I had the most wonderful experience on our honeymoon to Hotel Tugu Bali. From the moment that our sharply dressed driver picked us up from the airport with all sorts of fruit and water we knew that we were in for a treat. The room we stayed in (Dedari Suite) was fantastic with a semi-outdoor bathroom and a very cold air-conditioner. The food at Tugu Bali is amazing! It is all at once delicious and beautifully presented, not to mention the fact that the staff is more than happy to serve you anywhere on the property that you desire.  In the following days on our trip, we asked how we should go about getting a taxi to go into town, and the staff just smiled and told us that they would be happy to take us where ever we wanted to go. We even purchased a tour of the island and our guide managed to customize the trip en route and didn't charge us a dime. Our experience could not have been more perfect. I would recommend without any reservation that anyone considering a visit to Bali stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best kept secret in Bali Been all over Bali for years to find the best kept secret hideaway and finally I found it. The Hotel Tugu Bali is so relaxing and charming combining antiques, tropical gardens, a spa of dreams ( no wonder it is the runner-up spa in Robb's Report) with super deluxe rooms. Stayed in a suite downstairs for 2 days with private pool, the biggest most comfortable beds in Bali and a outside charming bathroom. After two days switched with the suite upstairs to experience a cosy teak wood suite, high sealings and the most romantic bathtub ever. The staff is so professional and personal at the same time no wonder lots of hotel guests are repeaters. You feel immediatly at home. The lobby was definetly the architectual highlight for meThe dining experiences are so unique and the food just outstanding ( javanese, balinese, western, chinese, seafood) you choose to eat in a old temple, traditional balinese dining huts, by the beach under the stars ( no other hotel around, a must) Definetly a secret hideaway in a dream location by a fisher village but still so close to the Nighlife and Shopping of Seminyak/Kuta( 15 min free hotel ride). I will be back as soon as possible
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: unique, high quality hotel We stayed 2 nights on a spa package. The hotel is well landscaped and the pool is excellent. The hotel is accross the street from the beach, the street has little traffic and there is a grass lawn prior to reaching the beach. Many surfers in the waters and a small fishing camp is 100 yds down the beach. Our room was upstairs and overlooked the beach and was very large - a/c in the bedroom with a sunken tub and chairs on the indoor veranda. The spa package was quite an experience and enjoyable. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.The Tugu is 30 minutes from Seminyak. If you can't use the hotel car, a taxi is $4.If you are looking for something different with a unique cultural experience, I would definitely recommend the Hotel Tugu. We enjoyed our stay.
Reviews.Author: JeffMA

Reviews.Content: Charming, with a few Buts The Hotel Tugu was a real trip. It was as if we were guests at a very wealthy Balinese home, with the host gone and the staff at our disposal. Our room was enormous, with a shaded private plunge pool and the biggest bed we have ever seen. The setting is lovely: it's near a small fishing village about 15 minutes north of Seminyak. It's quiet and incredibly relaxing, but if you're a perfectionist, forget it: there was a little peeling paint here, a little chipped wall there, and the antiques, while amazing, make the place feel a bit eccentric. What's great is that the place feels really local; it doesn't have the blandness that comes with even the most luxurious international chains. But you sacrifice some polish too. The staff was so nice we wanted to cry: we were one of three couples there, and they babied us to no end. And there are a lot of nice, low key touches: I asked for a surfing lesson one day, and got one from a housekeeper-cum-expert-surfer who's known for catching lobster using his board and a net. He took me out for two hours-- one of the greatest things I did in Bali-- and we weren't even charged for it. The one real disappointment was the food. Despite the hotel's strenuous claims about its culinary pedigree, the food is just not up to par (for instance, I ordered gado gado for lunch; it came covered in gloppy, oily french fries-- strange for a salad dish). Our one dinner there wasn't very good, and the desserts are really weak-- we have serious sweet tooths, but we just ended up ordering plain scoops of ice cream, instead of the hotel's faux sophisticated/bizarre desserts. This is a real problem because it's a (free) 15-30 minute drive to go anywhere else. We had fun at the Tugu, and there are really some amazing things about it, from the staff to the gardens to the antiques to the peaceful setting. But if I visited Bali again, I would spend a bit more and spring for one of the endless numbers of private beach villa rentals in the area. We had come to the Tugu from the Four Seasons in Ubud-- the finest, most stunning resort we had ever stayed at-- so maybe this was an unfair comparison. It's a shame, because with better food and a few paint jobs, the Tugu would be pretty much perfect.
